cyclone.name: MATTHEW
cyclone.current_location: about 70 miles SSE of Savannah Georgia
cyclone.trajectory: Moving north along the Georgia coast, then forecast to turn north-northeast and run very near the coasts of South Carolina and southern North Carolina
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or just south of Charleston, South Carolina

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Surf City NC to Cape Lookout NC
weather_observation.warning_coast: North of Fernandina Beach FL to Surf City NC (includes entire Georgia coast)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northeast Florida, Georgia, South Carolina and southern North Carolina coasts
weather_observation.wind: Hurricane-force winds possible with sustained 70–90 kt (80–105 mph) and higher gusts as the eyewall brushes the Georgia coast.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Peak inundation 6–9 ft possible along the Georgia coast including the Savannah River entrance.
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–12 inches with isolated maxima to 15 inches; life-threatening flash flooding possible.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; isolated tornado risk near the immediate coast.
